intro: Myosotis sylvatica subsp. sylvatica, commonly known as the forest forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue or violet flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The flowers attract pollinators like bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
